TensorFlow version: 2.0 (beta1) <denchmark-h:h4>Doc links:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/keras/callbacks/LearningRateScheduler>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/keras/callbacks/LearningRateScheduler</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r2.0/tensorflow/python/keras/callbacks.py>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r2.0/tensorflow/python/keras/callbacks.py</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h4>Description:</denchmark-h>
The definition should be expanded for clarity and better user experience. Instead of a one short sentence - "Learning rate scheduler." - maybe try: <denchmark-code>Learning rate scheduler which can be used to adjust the learning rate over time. Any function can be defined, such as a decay function that states which decay rate to use after a certain number of epochs or batches. Then this custom function can be passed as the `schedule` parameter in the `LearningRateSchuler` callback. </denchmark-code>
Alternatively, a description from the "Distributed Training with Keras" <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/beta/tutorials/distribute/keras>tutorial</denchmark-link> , linked in the API doc, can also be used: <denchmark-code>Learning Rate Scheduler: Using this callback, you can schedule the learning rate to change after every epoch/batch. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>Example:</denchmark-h>
The word "Example" is missing before the example. <denchmark-h:h4>Raises/Returns:</denchmark-h>
Should be added. For improvement suggestions of other classes see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/29958>#29958</denchmark-link>
